title: Type of tea most consumed in Great Britain 2014
summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
There is a difference of 45.0 between the maximum Type of tea English breakfast and minimum Type of tea Chai.
min_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
Type of tea English breakfast has the highest Share of respondents and Chai has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Type of tea, and Share of respondents in each Type of tea on the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
There is a difference of 45.0 between the maximum Type of tea English breakfast and minimum Type of tea Chai.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Type of tea in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Type of tea English breakfast and lowest at Type of tea Chai.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Type of tea Green.
The highest value at Type of tea English breakfast is 7.43x times more than the lowest value at Chai.
Share of respondents at Type of tea English breakfast is 52.0 , second place is Green at 23.0, and thirdly is Earl Grey at 22.0.
Type of tea Peppermint, and Other share the same value 16.0.
The lowest value 7.0 at Chai is almost 2.99 times smaller than the average value 17.38.
Summing up the values of all Type of teas, we get total 226.0.

data.Type of tea: Not applicable - I never drink tea
